intro: Monadenia comosa, commonly known as the woolly monadenia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive, hairy foliage. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, which are often visited by pollinators such as bees. Its leaves are typically trifoliate, consisting of three oval-shaped leaflets. Monadenia comosa is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
